title: NORTH | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
text: north noun [ U ] (also North) us /nɔːrθ/ uk /nɔːθ/ (written abbreviation N); (UK also Nth); (US also No.)A2 the North - Most of the country's population is concentrated in the north. - The wind is coming from the north. - The revolt in the north is believed to have been instigated by a high-ranking general. - The needle on a compass always points to magnetic north. - House prices in the north are rocketing (up). - cardinal point - compass reading - compass rose - E, e - eastbound - eastern - easternmost - geomagnetic pole - magnetic north - magnetic pole - N, n - northeasterly - northerly - northwest - NW - southern - southwesterly - SW - westernmost - westward You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics: Idiom north adjective (also North) us /nɔːrθ/ uk /nɔːθ/ (written abbreviation N); (UK also Nth); (US also No)north adverb (also North) us /nɔːrθ/ uk /nɔːθ/ (written abbreviation N); (UK also Nth); (US also No)A2 toward the north:
